alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:42PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, southwestern Philadelphia and northeastern Delaware Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 742 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Narberth, or near Philadelphia, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Yeadon, Folcroft, Swarthmore, Narberth, East Lansdowne, Darby Township, Morris Park, Bryn Mawr, Trout Lake, South Philadelphia, Nether Providence Township, Broomall, Roxborough, Chestnut Hill, Drexel Hill, Radnor Township, Darby, Lansdowne and Collingdale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 14 and 18. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 334 and 350. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 0. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 2 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
